title: Truncated square trapezohedron
text:
The square truncated trapezohedron is the second in an infinite series of <a href="truncated%20trapezohedron">truncated trapezohedron</a> polyhedra. It has 8 <a href="pentagon">pentagon</a> and 2 <a href="Square%20%28geometry%29">square</a> faces. 
This polyhedron can be constructed by taking a <a href="tetragonal%20trapezohedron">tetragonal trapezohedron</a> and <a href="Truncation%20%28geometry%29">truncating</a> the polar axis vertices. The <a href="Kite%20%28geometry%29">kite</a> faces of the <a href="trapezohedron">trapezohedron</a> become pentagons.
The vertices exist as 4 squares in four parallel planes, with alternating orientation in the middle creating the <a href="pentagons">pentagons</a>.
A "truncated trapezohedron" has all valence-3 vertices. This means that the dual polyhedrona <a href="gyroelongated%20square%20dipyramid">gyroelongated square dipyramid</a> has all triangular faces.
It represents the <a href="dual%20polyhedron">dual polyhedron</a> to the <a href="Johnson%20solid">Johnson solid</a>, <a href="gyroelongated%20square%20dipyramid">gyroelongated square dipyramid</a>, with specific proportions:
